result.markdown:
---
title: "Number"
---






### Number Types

`Python` has 3 types of numbers 




::: {.cell}

```{.python .cell-code}
type(1)
#> <class 'int'>
type(1.2)
#> <class 'float'>
type(1 + 2j)
#> <class 'complex'>
```
:::




### Arithmatic Operators





::: {.cell}

```{.python .cell-code}
10 + 3
#> 13
10 - 3
#> 7
10 * 3
#> 30
10 ** 3
#> 1000
10 / 3 
#> 3.3333333333333335
10 // 3 # floor division
#> 3
10 % 3 # modulus
#> 1
```
:::




### Augmented Assignment Operator





::: {.cell}

```{.python .cell-code}
x = 10
x = x + 3
x
#> 13
```
:::




Shorter version




::: {.cell}

```{.python .cell-code}
x = 10
x += 3
x
#> 13
```
:::




### Function with Numbers




::: {.cell}

```{.python .cell-code}
round(2.3)
#> 2
abs(-2.3)
#> 2.3
```
:::




using [`math` module](https://docs.python.org/3/library/math.html)




::: {.cell}

```{.python .cell-code}
import math

math.ceil(2.3)
#> 3
math.factorial(3)
#> 6
```
:::
